|availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 06/08/2011 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 649659019607 |ean = 4710700927533 |newegg = |asin = B000Z4J29Q |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Ralink;RT3092; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 300 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This device supports AP, STA, Bridge, WDS, and ''universal repeater'' modes. "1244-00000737-50Z" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. FCC docs show two USB ports installed, but this model does not have any populated USB ports. :Note: [https://wikidevi.wi-cat.ru/files/Ralink/RT3662%20product%20brief.pdf The RT3662 SoC only has two native USB 2.0 host IFs] :.. or 1x host and 1x slave/device. The FCC test report lists the following as identical models *'''Edimax BR-6475nD''', GR-475nD, EW-7475PDD *Intellinet 525039 *SMC SMCE21011 V2 *[http://uk.hardware.info/productinfo/126429/edimax-br-6475nd On '''uk.hardware.info'''] :The 2.4GHz radio is using two '''Microchip''' ('''SST''') Power Amplifier ICs (SST12LP15A?). :The 5GHz radio is using two [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=944 '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE2537L] 5GHz Power Amplifier ICs. :The third receive chain is unpopulated. There are only two antennas in use. :[http://www.xfastest.com/thread-83609-1-1.html Testing of the device on '''XFastest''' (CN)] (w/ good external and Web UI images) '''EDIMAX''' (2.4 GHz) and '''EDIMAX2''' (5 GHz) SSIDs (probably changed from default?) :The sample SSIDs shown in the manual are '''Edimax''', 80:1F:02 OUIs :If not these or '''EDIMAX'''+'''EDIMAX2''', the default SSIDs :may ''possibly'' be '''Edimax2.4GHz''' and '''Edimax5GHz'''. The power adapter shown in the FCC photos and on '''XFastest''' is a :'''DVE''' DSA-12GX-12 FUS 120120 (100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.3A -> 12VDC, 1A). ==Links of Interest== [http://www.edimax.com/images/Image/OpenSourceCode/Wireless/Router/BR-6475nD/Edimax_RT3662_6X75nD_GPL_20110920.zip '''Edimax''''s GPL source code for the device] (build environment is Fedora 7 i386) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/edimax/edimax_br-6475nd_a |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/edimax/br-6475nd |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=48072 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = ramips |subtarget = rt3883 |arch = mipsel_74kc |support_started_version = 14.07 |current_supported_version = |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
To RTL8367R <--   [ (TxD) (GND) (RxD) ][ (Vcc) ]    --> To LEDs
====Serial Recovery==== The serial port is shown as being under the PoE board in the FCC photos. :It is '''almost certainly''' omitted in this particular model. ==Pictures==
'''User Images''' File:BR-6475nD Board top.png|board top, from the FCC, serial pinout marked File:BR-6475nD RTL8367R Switch.jpg|the RTL8367R Switch File:BR-6475nD Board bottom.png|Bottom view
